text: The New York Knickerbockers were one of the first organized baseball teams who played with the baseball rules that are still used today. The team was started by Alexander Cartwright, who is said to be one of the original developers of modern baseball. In 1849, the New York Knickerbockers wore the first ever recorded baseball uniform. Their uniforms were pants made of blue wool, white flannel shirts and straw hats. The team was based in New York City. It was established in 1845 and disestablished in the 1870s. == References == *Orem, Preston D. (1961), Baseball (1845-1881) From the Newspaper Accounts, Altadena, CA: Self-published ASIN B0007HTB88 *Peterson, Harold (1969, 1973), The Man Who Invented Baseball, New York: Charles Scribner's Sons == Other websites == *"The Knickerbocker Base Ball Club" at Hickoksports.com *"The History of Baseball â€“ Alexander Cartwright" at About.com Category:History of baseball Category:History of New York City Category:Sports in New York City Category:1840s establishments in New York (state) Category:1845 establishments in the United States Category:19th-century disestablishments in the United States Category:1870s disestablishments Category:Baseball teams in the United States
title: New York Knickerbockers (baseball)
